message.content: A merism is a figure of speech in which two or more words are used to express the whole, often by stating that something extends from one end to another. It can also be used to emphasize the extent of an action or quality. For example, "from dawn till dusk" implies the entire day; "head to toe" refers to every part of a person's body. Merisms are commonly found in literature and poetry as they add vividness and emphasis to descriptions.
